mapscanner styles

Mark Padgham

2020-03-03

Source: vignettes/mapstyles.Rmd
mapstyles.Rmd

This short vignette demonstrates the three map styles available in the ms_generate_map() function. These correspond to three of the styles provided by mapbox, converted to black and white format for use with mapscanner. The styles are demonstrated here using the same area of Omaha, Nebraska, U.S.A., defined as the bounding box provided by the osmdata::getbb() function, shrunk to 30% of it’s size.

bb <- osmdata::getbb ("omaha nebraska")
shrink <- 0.3 # shrink that bounding box to 30% size
bb <- t (apply (bb, 1, function (i)
                 mean (i) + c (-shrink, shrink) * diff (i) / 2))
bb
##        [,1]      [,2]
## x -96.12923 -96.01011
## y  41.26145  41.32220
##        [,1]      [,2]
## x -96.12923 -96.01011
## y  41.26145  41.32220

The following then illustrates the three different styles enabled by the style parameter of the ms_generate_map() function.

style = ‘light’

ms_generate_map (bbox = bb, max_tiles = 16L, style = "light",
                 mapname = "omaha-light")
## Loading required namespace: jpeg
## Successfully generated 'omaha-light.pdf' and 'omaha-light.png'
image (png::readPNG ("omaha-light.png"), col = gray.colors(20),
       xaxt = "n", yaxt = "n")

style = ‘streets’

ms_generate_map (bbox = bb, max_tiles = 16L, style = "streets",
                 mapname = "omaha-streets")
## Successfully generated 'omaha-streets.pdf' and 'omaha-streets.png'
image (png::readPNG ("omaha-streets.png"), col = gray.colors(20),
       xaxt = "n", yaxt = "n")

style = ‘outdoors’

ms_generate_map (bbox = bb, max_tiles = 16L, style = "outdoors",
                 mapname = "omaha-outdoors")
## Successfully generated 'omaha-outdoors.pdf' and 'omaha-outdoors.png'
image (png::readPNG ("omaha-outdoors.png"), col = gray.colors(20),
       xaxt = "n", yaxt = "n")
